Package ohos.nfc

Class NfcController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.nfc.NfcController

  • public final class NfcController
extends Object
    Provides interfaces for NFC management.

    Using interfaces provided by this class, you can enable and disable NFC, and query the NFC capabilities and status.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Communication#NFC

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  NfcController.ReaderModeCallback
      A callback to be invoked when the system finds a tag while the foreground page is operating in reader mode.
      class  NfcController.ReaderModeCallbackStub
      Provides ReaderModeCallback for communicate with remote.

    • Field Detail

      • EXTRA_NFC_STATE

        public static final String EXTRA_NFC_STATE
        Indicates the NFC status.

        This is a string constant used to read the NFC status from a broadcast message.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_NFC_TRANSACTION

        public static final String EXTRA_NFC_TRANSACTION
        Indicates the NFC transaction information.

        This is a constant string used to obtain the NFC transaction information from a field-on broadcast message.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Indicates the key (in string format) used to obtain the tag information.

        Indicates a field-off event detected by NFC.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static NfcController getInstance​(Context context)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Obtains a singleton instance of the NfcController class.

        If no singleton instance is available, a singleton instance will be created.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Returns:
        Returns a singleton instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the caller is missing required context.
        Since:
        1

      • openNfc

        public boolean openNfc​()
                throws NfcPermissionException
        Enables NFC.
        Returns:
        Returns true if NFC is enabled or has been enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NfcPermissionException - Throws this exception if you have no permission to invoke this method.
        Since:
        1

      • closeNfc

        public boolean closeNfc​()
                 throws NfcPermissionException
        Disables NFC.
        Returns:
        Returns true if NFC is disabled or has been disabled; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NfcPermissionException - Throws this exception if you have no permission to invoke this method.
        Since:
        1

      • isNfcOpen

        public boolean isNfcOpen​()
        Checks whether NFC is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if NFC is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getNfcState

        public int getNfcState​()
        Obtains the NFC status.

        The NFC status can be any of the following:

        • STATE_OFF: Indicates that NFC is disabled.
        • STATE_TURNING_ON: Indicates that NFC is being enabled.
        • STATE_ON: Indicates that NFC is enabled.
        • STATE_TURNING_OFF: Indicates that NFC is being disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns the NFC status.
        Since:
        1

      • isNfcAvailable

        public boolean isNfcAvailable​()
        Checks whether a device supports NFC.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the device supports NFC; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setReaderMode

        public void setReaderMode​(Ability ability,
                          NfcController.ReaderModeCallback callback,
                          int flags,
                          PacMapEx pacMapEx)
        Enables reader mode for a specified Ability.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the specified Ability.
        callback - Indicates the callback to be invoked when an NFC tag is discovered.
        flags - Indicates polling technologies and some optional parameters.
        pacMapEx - Indicates additional parameters for enabling reader mode.
        Since:
        4

      • unsetReaderMode

        public void unsetReaderMode​(Ability ability)
        Disables reader mode for a specified Ability.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the specified Ability.
        Since:
        4

      • registerForegroundDispatch

        public void registerForegroundDispatch​(Ability ability,
                                       IntentAgent intent,
                                       List<String> filters,
                                       String[][] profiles)
        Enables foreground dispatch of specified NFC tags to a given Ability.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the given Ability.
        intent - Indicates the intent of the Ability when an NFC tag is discovered.
        filters - Indicates the intent filters.
        profiles - Indicates the list of NFC tag profiles.
        Since:
        4

      • unregisterForegroundDispatch

        public void unregisterForegroundDispatch​(Ability ability)
        Disables foreground dispatch of NFC tags to a specified Ability.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the specified Ability.
        Since:
        4
